title: Understanding Scattering Spectroscopy
text: Scattering spectroscopy involves the interaction of light with particles in a sample. Can you think of what happens to the light when it encounters these particles?

title: Types of Scattering
text: There are different types of scattering, such as Rayleigh and Raman scattering. Consider how these types differ in terms of the energy of the scattered light.

hintAnswer: The scattering of light by particles in a sample
title: Identifying the Primary Phenomenon
text: What is the primary phenomenon that scattering spectroscopy measures?
choices: The scattering of light by particles in a sample
The absorption of light by a sample
The emission of light from a sample
The reflection of light from a surface

title: Applications of Scattering Spectroscopy
text: Scattering spectroscopy is used in various fields, including material science and biology. Think about how it might be used to study the structure of materials or biological samples.
